newsitem.title: UK: U.K. Sept oil output up at 2.493 mln bpd - APR.
newsitem.headline: U.K. Sept oil output up at 2.493 mln bpd - APR.

text.p: U.K. oil production in September rose by 139,375 barrels per day (bpd) to 2.493 million bpd from 2.354 million in August, industry newsletter Aberdeen Petroleum Report (APR) said on Wednesday.
APR said September output was the highest monthly average since March, when 2.535 million bpd was produced.
The rise was due largely to fields returning to production after summer maintenance shutdowns and increased output from recent start-ups.

"BP's relatively new fields Andrew and Harding were among those making a significant monthly improvement during October, Andrew figures being boosted by the contribution of the Cyrus satellite," the newsletter said.
Amerada Hess' Scott was also ahead of August figures while Enterprise's Piper-Saltire-Chanter complex recovered from maintenance to rise to 108,930 bpd from 75,660 bpd in August.
